I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of yearning and excitement about unexplored futures. The music of October Sky is cleverly chosen because it builds up intensity and desire and necessity for change.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a spiritual energy that the Japanese people held in that age, based on Miyazawa’s writings and artwork. Director and Cast Commentary Track
